verses.kjv: Woe to the rebellious children, saith the LORD, that take counsel, but not of me; and that cover with a covering, but not of my spirit, that they may add sin to sin:
verses.ct: "How terrible it will be for my rebellious children," declares the LORD, "who make plans without consulting me, who form alliances that don't come from my spirit, piling one sin on top of another.

verses.kjv: That walk to go down into Egypt, and have not asked at my mouth; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to trust in the shadow of Egypt!
verses.ct: They head down to Egypt without asking for my direction, seeking protection from Pharaoh's power and taking refuge under Egypt's shelter!

verses.kjv: Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame, and the trust in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.
verses.ct: But Pharaoh's protection will only bring you disgrace, and Egypt's shelter will result in your humiliation.

verses.kjv: For his princes were at Zoan, and his ambassadors came to Hanes.
verses.ct: Though their officials have arrived at Zoan and their envoys have reached Hanes,

verses.kjv: They were all ashamed of a people that could not profit them, nor be an help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.
verses.ct: everyone will be embarrassed by a nation that can do nothing for them — offering no help, no benefit, only shame and disgrace."

verses.kjv: The burden of the beasts of the south: into the land of trouble and anguish, from whence come the young and old lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they will carry their riches upon the shoulders of young asses, and their treasures upon the bunches of camels, to a people that shall not profit them.
verses.ct: A message about the animals of the Negev: Through a land of hardship and danger, where lions young and old roam, where vipers and deadly serpents fly, they load their wealth on the backs of donkeys and their treasures on camels' humps — all for a nation that cannot help them.

verses.kjv: For the Egyptians shall help in vain, and to no purpose: therefore have I cried concerning this, Their strength is to sit still.
verses.ct: Egypt's help is completely worthless and useless. That is why I have called her "Rahab Who Sits Still."

verses.kjv: Now go, write it before them in a table, and note it in a book, that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever:
verses.ct: "Now go and write this on a tablet in front of them, and record it in a scroll, so it will serve as a permanent witness for all future generations:

verses.kjv: That this is a rebellious people, lying children, children that will not hear the law of the LORD:
verses.ct: These are rebellious people, dishonest children — children who refuse to listen to the LORD's instruction.

verses.kjv: Which say to the seers, See not; and to the prophets, Prophesy not unto us right things, speak unto us smooth things, prophesy deceits:
verses.ct: They tell the seers, 'Stop seeing visions!' and the prophets, 'Don't tell us what's really true. Tell us pleasant things instead. Give us comfortable illusions.

verses.kjv: Get you out of the way, turn aside out of the path, cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us.
verses.ct: Get out of our way! Move off the path! Stop confronting us with the Holy One of Israel.'"

verses.kjv: Wherefore thus saith the Holy One of Israel, Because ye despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and stay thereon:
verses.ct: Therefore the Holy One of Israel says this: "Because you reject this message and instead rely on oppression and deceit, leaning on them for support,

verses.kjv: Therefore this iniquity shall be to you as a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking cometh suddenly at an instant.
verses.ct: this sin will become like a crack in a high wall that bulges outward — its collapse comes suddenly, in an instant.

verses.kjv: And he shall break it as the breaking of the potters’ vessel that is broken in pieces; he shall not spare: so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth, or to take water withal out of the pit.
verses.ct: It will shatter like a clay pot smashed to pieces without mercy, broken so completely that among the fragments you won't find a single piece large enough to scoop coals from a fireplace or dip water from a cistern."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel, has said: "Your salvation lies in returning to me and resting. Your strength comes through quiet trust and confidence. But you refused.

verses.kjv: But ye said, No; for we will flee upon horses; therefore shall ye flee: and, We will ride upon the swift; therefore shall they that pursue you be swift.
verses.ct: Instead you said, 'No! We'll escape on horses!' So you will have to flee. You said, 'We'll ride on fast steeds!' So your pursuers will be even faster.

verses.kjv: One thousand shall flee at the rebuke of one; at the rebuke of five shall ye flee: till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a mountain, and as an ensign on an hill.
verses.ct: 1,000 of you will run from the threat of just one enemy. When 5 threaten you, all of you will scatter — until you're left standing alone like a flagpole on a mountaintop, like a lone banner on a hill."

verses.kjv: And therefore will the LORD wait, that he may be gracious unto you, and therefore will he be exalted, that he may have mercy upon you: for the LORD is a God of judgment: blessed are all they that wait for him.
verses.ct: Yet the LORD longs to show you grace, and he rises to have mercy on you. For the LORD is a God of justice. How blessed are all who wait for him!

verses.kjv: For the people shall dwell in Zion at Jerusalem: thou shalt weep no more: he will be very gracious unto thee at the voice of thy cry; when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.
verses.ct: People of Zion, who live in Jerusalem — you will cry no more. He will be deeply gracious to you when you call out to him. The moment he hears you, he will respond.

verses.kjv: And though the Lord give you the bread of adversity, and the water of affliction, yet shall not thy teachers be removed into a corner any more, but thine eyes shall see thy teachers:
verses.ct: Even though the Lord may give you the bread of hardship and the water of suffering, your teachers will no longer be hidden away. You will see your teachers with your own eyes,

verses.kjv: And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye in it, when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the left.
verses.ct: and whenever you start to turn to the right or to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you saying, "This is the correct path — walk on it."

verses.kjv: Ye shall defile also the covering of thy graven images of silver, and the ornament of thy molten images of gold: thou shalt cast them away as a menstruous cloth; thou shalt say unto it, Get thee hence.
verses.ct: Then you will treat your silver-plated carved idols and your gold-covered metal images as something disgusting. You will throw them away like filthy rags, saying to them, "Get away from me!"

verses.kjv: Then shall he give the rain of thy seed, that thou shalt sow the ground withal; and bread of the increase of the earth, and it shall be fat and plenteous: in that day shall thy cattle feed in large pastures.
verses.ct: Then he will send rain for the seed you plant in the ground, and the food that the land produces will be rich and abundant. On that day your livestock will graze in wide-open pastures.

verses.kjv: The oxen likewise and the young asses that ear the ground shall eat clean provender, which hath been winnowed with the shovel and with the fan.
verses.ct: The oxen and donkeys that work the soil will eat seasoned feed that has been properly winnowed with fork and shovel.

verses.kjv: And there shall be upon every high mountain, and upon every high hill, rivers and streams of waters in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.
verses.ct: On every tall mountain and every high hill, streams and channels of water will flow on the day of the great defeat, when the towers come crashing down.

verses.kjv: Moreover the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven days, in the day that the LORD bindeth up the breach of his people, and healeth the stroke of their wound.
verses.ct: The moonlight will shine as bright as the sun, and the sunlight will be 7 times brighter — like the light of 7 days combined — on the day the LORD bandages his people's wounds and heals the injuries he inflicted.

verses.kjv: Behold, the name of the LORD cometh from far, burning with his anger, and the burden thereof is heavy: his lips are full of indignation, and his tongue as a devouring fire:
verses.ct: Look! The name of the LORD approaches from far away, blazing with anger and heavy with fury. His lips overflow with rage, and his tongue is like a consuming fire.

verses.kjv: And his breath, as an overflowing stream, shall reach to the midst of the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of vanity: and there shall be a bridle in the jaws of the people, causing them to err.
verses.ct: His breath is like a flooding river that rises up to the neck. He comes to sift the nations in a sieve of destruction, and to put a bit in the jaws of the peoples that leads them astray.

verses.kjv: Ye shall have a song, as in the night when a holy solemnity is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one goeth with a pipe to come into the mountain of the LORD, to the mighty One of Israel.
verses.ct: But you will sing as on the night when a sacred festival begins, and your hearts will be glad like those who march with flutes on their way to the mountain of the LORD, to the Rock of Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall cause his glorious voice to be heard, and shall shew the lighting down of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and with the flame of a devouring fire, with scattering, and tempest, and hailstones.
verses.ct: The LORD will make his majestic voice heard and reveal the force of his striking arm, with furious anger and consuming fire, with cloudbursts, storms, and hailstones.

verses.kjv: For through the voice of the LORD shall the Assyrian be beaten down, which smote with a rod.
verses.ct: At the LORD's voice, Assyria will be shattered — the nation that once struck others with its rod.

verses.kjv: And in every place where the grounded staff shall pass, which the LORD shall lay upon him, it shall be with tabrets and harps: and in battles of shaking will he fight with it.
verses.ct: Every blow of the rod of punishment that the LORD brings down on them will be accompanied by tambourines and harps, as he fights against them with powerful strokes of his arm.

verses.kjv: For Tophet is ordained of old; yea, for the king it is prepared; he hath made it deep and large: the pile thereof is fire and much wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle it.
verses.ct: Topheth has been prepared long in advance — yes, it is ready even for the king. He has made its fire pit deep and wide, with an enormous pile of fire and wood. The breath of the LORD, like a stream of burning sulfur, sets it ablaze.
